turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: ...Quiver ladies, he's gonna set the world on fire right here from 5 to 7! You'll know everything there is to know about the D-man. His dreams, his desires, his most intimate of intimates.  And from what I'm looking at intimate is the stud muffin's middle name. So tell me my main man... you nervous in the service?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Uh... not really.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I didn't come here to play Dumbo on the radio. So tomorrow between 5 and 7 give yourself a hand, that clear pal?

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: Crystal.

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: My main man! Please don't leave me here alone. My head's killing me and my adoring fans are gonna tear me apart! Get me outta here!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I'll take you to the bar, after that, you're on your own.

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: Oh, yes! Do that! You treat me right, man. Tell me all about yourself, your roots, your personal life, your childhood dreams...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I don't think this is a good time...

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: ...You got brothers and sisters? What about your dad? Tell me about your dad! What was he like? Physically? Big, I suppose?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Yeah, very big, a giant.

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: I didn't have a dad... never saw him... never even heard him. 50 billion people listen to me every day... and he doesn't hear me...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: You don't do what I say... I'll waste you myself. Got it?

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: Got it...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Six to the left. One to the right.

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: He's on vacation.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: We got to find the leader. Mangalores don't fight without a leader.

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: Maybe we oughta be going, what do you think?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Not without Leeloo.

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: Like Korben, can I have 30 seconds of your time here?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: You know how to fly this thing?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: It's like a cab isn't it?

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: I don't even know what I'm looking for!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Fuck it! Hold tight!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Solid little jobs, aren't they?

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: Dear listeners, your favorite DJ is alive and kicking. It's seven o'clock and time for the news. Tune in tomorrow for another adventure.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: What did you say? What did you do?

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: Nothing! Swear to God, I didn't do nothing!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Look, you did something that set it off. Try to remember. Concentrate. Tell me exactly what you did!!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Is that all?

turns.speaker: LOC RHOD
turns.text: Yeah... then I sighed... like this.

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Major Dallas, if our calculations are correct you still have 57 hours owed to the Federal Army on your enlistment which is more than you will need for a mission of the utmost importance.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: What mission?

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: To save the world.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Where have I heard this song before?

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: You're to leave immediately for Fhloston Paradise. Retrieve four Stones from the Diva Plavalaguna. And bring them back with the utmost discretion as possible. Any questions'?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Just one... why me?

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Three reasons... One: As part of The Elite Special Forces Unit of the Federated Army you are an expert in the use of all weapons and spacecraft needed for this mission.

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Two: Of all the members of your unit you were the most highly decorated.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: And the third one?

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: You're the only one left alive...

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Don't you open your messages?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I've had enough good news for today

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: You have won the annual Gemini contest and a trip to Fhloston Paradise. For two. Congratulations. Here are your tickets.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: You couldn't come up with something a little more discreet?

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Old tricks are the best tricks eh?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I'm not going.

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: One reason... I want to stay the only one left alive.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: ...Shit!

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: It's my wife.

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: I thought you were divorced.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I mean my future.. my ex.. My future ex.. if she sees you here I'm finished.  She hates you guys. It's what killed us in the first place. Please...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: ...Sorry, General, but we've got no choice! It'll only take a minute! Let me set up another meeting and I'll be back.

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Three of us will never fit in there!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Oh, yes you will...

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Apipoulai!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I suppose that means "Hi" ?

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Valo massa... Chacha hamas.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Uh..you're welcome.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: You hear that?

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Cornelius..

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Oh god!

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Dinoine chagantakat!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Took the words right out of my mouth. Go on... I'll be right with you.  It's our honeymoon. We're going to use the trip to get to know each other better.

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Apipoulai!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Not hard to find you...just follow the Chaos...

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Love...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Yes! But "love" isn't the operative word here, PEACE is!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Sometimes you can't learn everything from a screen..sometimes it's better to ask someone who has experience..

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: What is... Make Love?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Finished what?

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Learning language.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Which one?

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: All 900.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: You learned 900 languages in five minutes?!

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Yes! Now it's your turn! I learned your language, you have to learn mine!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I know how to say "Hello". Teach me how to say "Good-bye", that's all I need.

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Apipoussan!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Apipoussan?

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Good! Do you know how we say "make love"?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Uh...

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: ...Hoppi-hoppa.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Here we go again...

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: You know women normally change five times more than men.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: You get that off the screen?

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Yes... you know there's a lot of differences between men women.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: You noticed..

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: OK, you can turn around!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Where you going?

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: I'm going to see the Diva sing. What's the matter?... Do I look bad?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: No, not at all!  I mean, just the opposite, you're... you're beautiful!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I told you I need to work in peace. Remember? I need to concentrate.

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: And you can't concentrate with me around?.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: It's difficult.

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: You're nothing but a... a...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: The words you're looking for weren't in the dictionary you studied. I won't be long.

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: I'm so very sad.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Why? We did pretty well, wouldn't you say?

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Five hundred wars... Arms... Drugs... Money... Everything you create is used to destroy...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I told you not to read all that crap!

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Protect life... Until death.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Leeloo? The Stones! We have to open them! How does it work?

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: The wind blows... the fire burns...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I know all that, Leeloo! I'm talking about the Stones.

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: ...The rain falls...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: It's up to you now, Angel!

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: I'm so tired...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: You can sleep tomorrow... come on...

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: I want to sleep... forever...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Leeloo! Listen to me! I'll take you on a vacation afterwards! A real vacation, this time, for as long as you want. Come on! You can do it!

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: What's the use of saving lives... when you see what you do with them!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: You're right but there are lots of good things... beautiful things...

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: ...Like love...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: But I don't know love... I'm like a machine programmed to save other people's lives but never to have one of my own.

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: I have thousands of memories but none of them are mine... There is no need for me other than this. I'm immortal but I have no life.

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Yes, you do! I need you. More than you can imagine! Stand up straight!

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Why?... Why would you need me?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Because...

turns.speaker: LEELOO
turns.text: Tell me...

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I love you...

turns.speaker: THAI
turns.text: Not going to open?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: I've never gotten a message that wasn't bad news.

turns.speaker: THAI
turns.text: How someone strong like you scared from a message? Is good news I sure!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: The last two messages I got?  The first one was from my wife telling me she was leaving! And the second was from my lawyer telling me he was leaving too... with my wife.

turns.speaker: THAI
turns.text: You right that is bad.. but mathematically luck must change! Grandfather say: "It never rain every day." This is good news guarantee.. I bet you lunch!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: At least I won lunch.

turns.speaker: THAI
turns.text: Good philosophy..see good in bad.. I like..I prepare number one dessert.. special for you and pussy..

turns.speaker: MUGGER
turns.text: The cash man!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Been here long?

turns.speaker: MUGGER
turns.text: Don't fuck with me man or I'll blow you into tomorrow!

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: Isn't that a Z140? Alleviated titanium. Neuro charged assault model?

turns.speaker: MUGGER
turns.text: Uh..

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: You know you could hurt someone with this puppy..good thing it's not loaded..

turns.speaker: MUGGER
turns.text: It's not?

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: You gotta push the little yellow button...

turns.speaker: MUGGER
turns.text: Thanks..

turns.speaker: KORBEN
turns.text: You're welcome..

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: This is all that survived?

turns.speaker: MACTILBURGH
turns.text: Actually only one cell survived..

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Have you identified it?

turns.speaker: MACTILBURGH
turns.text: It's not that easy..we've never encountered anything like it before..you see normal human beings have 40 DNA memo groums..which is more than enough for any species to perpetuate itself..This one has 200,000.

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Talk English Doc.

turns.speaker: MACTILBURGH
turns.text: This cell is like a huge library. It has infinite genetic knowledge stored inside. Almost like it was...engineered.

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Sounds like a freak of nature to me.

turns.speaker: MACTILBURGH
turns.text: Yes... I can't wait to meet him.

turns.speaker: MACTILBURGH
turns.text: The compositional elements of his DNA chain are the same as ours, there are simply more of them tightly packed. His knowledge is probably limitless..

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Is there any danger? Some kind of virus?

turns.speaker: MACTILBURGH
turns.text: We put it through the cellular hygiene detector. The cell is for lack of a better word... perfect.

turns.speaker: MACTILBURGH
turns.text: ...This is the crucial phase, The reconstruction of pigment. Cells are bombarded with slightly greasy solar atoms which forces the body cells to react, to protect themselves. That means growing skin. Clever, eh?

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Wonderful!

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: This thing solid?

turns.speaker: MACTILBURGH
turns.text: An elephant couldn't crack it.

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Mr. President, let me introduce you to Professor Mactilburgh, who runs the center.

turns.speaker: MACTILBURGH
turns.text: It's an honor to receive you. Mr. President.

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: I managed to contact the Mondoshawan. They deplore the incident, but accept our apologies.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: And the Stones?  Did you find them in the wreckage?

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: The-Stones weren't aboard the ship.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: ...What do you mean?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I want your best man on this!

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: Don't worry, Sir. I have the perfect one.

turns.speaker: MUNRO
turns.text: They just landed in the desert.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: How much time is left?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Staedert, do you read me?

turns.speaker: STAEDERT
turns.text: I can hear you, Mr. President, but I can't see you .

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Is that better?

turns.speaker: STAEDERT
turns.text: Perfect, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I have to address the Supreme Council in 10 minutes. Just the facts, General.

turns.speaker: STAEDERT
turns.text: There are no results from the chemical and molecular analysis as of yet, all the calibers are overshot..we're hoping a thermo nucleatic imaging..

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: What you are saying is you don't know what this..thing..is.

turns.speaker: STAEDERT
turns.text: Not yet Sir..The only thing we know is it just keeps getting bigger!

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Options.

turns.speaker: STAEDERT
turns.text: Wait or act.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Recommendations.

turns.speaker: STAEDERT
turns.text: My philosophy Mr. President is shoot first ask questions later. I don't like uninvited guests.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Gentlemen?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Staedert?  What's going on?  Did you destroy it?

turns.speaker: STAEDERT
turns.text: I'm about to, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Lord forgive me.. they already know too, much..

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: "..in which all the history of the Universe resides ..all the strength..all the hope..Protect us from Evil.."

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Amen..

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Father.. it in the most extraordinary thing.. the greatest find in history..can you imagine the implications.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Only too well... here you must be parched..

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: A weapon against evil.  Amazing!  I am going to be famous.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Then let us toast to your fame!  Here Billy..

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Drink!

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: To fame.. salud..

turns.speaker: ZORG
turns.text: How's that? Can you hear me better now?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Yes, Mr. Zorg, I hear you perfectly! So, how was the concert?

turns.speaker: ZORG
turns.text: Who gives a shit! I didn't come here to listen to music! Listen up instead of running off at the mouth! The batteries on my phone are almost gone.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Yes, Sir!

turns.speaker: ZORG
turns.text: Dispatch me another ZFX200 immediately. Someone stole mine.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Right away, Sir. I'll send you a new one to the hotel.

turns.speaker: ZORG
turns.text: I'm not at the hotel!

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Am I disturbing you?

turns.speaker: ZORG
turns.text: No... not at all.  Where are you?

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: ...Not far, now.

turns.speaker: ZORG
turns.text: Really? Maybe I can get you on my screen and see you at last!

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Do you have the picture now Mr. Zorg?

turns.speaker: ZORG
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: How's our deal coming along?

turns.speaker: ZORG
turns.text: Fine, just fine!  I'll have the 4 pieces you asked for any time now.  But it wasn't easy. My costs have tripled.

turns.speaker: ZORG
turns.text: The Stones will be here. I'll see to it personally!

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: ...I can't wait to be among you.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Welcome home.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Do you know how much I missed you?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What's this... have you been smoking... ?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Smoking?  I'm not smoking.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Your clothing reeks of it.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: You know, Amy, I've been sitting around in bars and everywhere following this guy... I mean, is this what I get first thing?  Before you even "hello," you accuse me... ?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I'm not accusing you...

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Well, I'm not smoking, okay?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Okay, I believe you.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: We've been all through that.  I've been on my best behavior.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: How's the detective business?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Business was fine.  I'll tell you what, you couldn't pay me enough to live down there.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You better not be smoking, that's all I can say.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Honey, I'm not, please...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You think you'll have time for the water heater this weekend?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Sure.  I'll call the guy.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You're not using the same guy who tried to fix it?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I'm not using him again for anything.  He was worthless.  You have bridge here Saturday?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Betty's out of town so we're playing next week.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: This is the mortgage.  This is Cindy's college money.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Sometimes you can't know what I'm doing.  It's better that way.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It's a missing persons case... a long shot.  I'll give it two months, two months at most, then I'll be back.  We'll take a vacation.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Why the gun?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I'm not gonna need it.  I won't even wear it.  It's a precaution.  Don't worry about me.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Amy, it's me.  Listen very carefully..

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Tom?  Where have you been... ?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Amy, just listen.  Take Cindy and get out of the house.  Do it now. Go to a hotel and stay there...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What's wrong?  Are you alright?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I'm okay.  Please, honey, I can't explain.  Don't use the phone, just pack a bag and get out.  I'm on my way.  I'll be back at the house in three hours.  Call me from the hotel when you get there

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: ... What's going on?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Just do it, Amy, please, go.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What happened to you?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I'm okay, honey, I'm okay.  Are you alright?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What's going on, Tom?  What happened?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I can't tell you, Amy.  You know I can't.  You have to trust me...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Tom...

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It has to be this way for now.  It won't be long.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Why haven't you called?  Why don't you answer your phone?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I don't know.  I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You're sorry?  What was I supposed to think?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You owe me an explanation.  You can't treat me like this.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I wanted to call.  I couldn't.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You couldn't?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: You don't understand...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: No, I don't, because you're not telling me anything!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I was in hell.  If I called you... if I heard your voice... it would have been so easy for me to quit. I couldn't do that.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You should have.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Amy, I'm not going to let anything happen to us.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Look where we are.  Look at yourself.  You son of a bitch, you don't have any idea what you're putting me through...

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I don't know what to say

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You're killing me...

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Don't...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What was I supposed to think happened to you?!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Amy...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Who are you calling?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Mrs. Christian.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: She's all I've got.  She's the only witness.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Tom... she's dead.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: She died in her sleep three days ago.  It was in the paper...

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I just talked to her.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: What are these?

turns.speaker: ANGRY DEALER
turns.text: Mixed hard bondage.  Rape films. Sick shit.  Buy five, get one free.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Anything harder?

turns.speaker: ANGRY DEALER
turns.text: There's nothing harder.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Snuff?

turns.speaker: ANGRY DEALER
turns.text: What you see is what I got, mister.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: You know where I can get it?  I have a lot of money to spend.

turns.speaker: ANGRY DEALER
turns.text: There ain't no such thing as snuff. Why don't you fuck off?

turns.speaker: DINO
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I just got a call... two seconds ago, some motherfucker called... says he knows about the loop.

turns.speaker: DINO
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: The loop!  The girl we did, what the fuck do you think I'm talking about?!  This guy calls and says he knows about the fucking loop...

turns.speaker: DINO
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm telling you...

turns.speaker: DINO
turns.text: Blow me, you paranoid fuck, that's impossible.  Why are you bothering me with this... ?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Because somebody just fucking called me and fucking laid it out!

turns.speaker: DINO
turns.text: There's nothing there, you brain- dead cunt.  Think about it.  There's absolutely no way in this world to connect us to anything.  I want you to hang the phone up, and if you call me about this again I'm going to send a friend of mine out there and have him crack you open with a fucking rib spreader.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Dino...

turns.speaker: DINO
turns.text: Nobody knows anything.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What the fuck... !

turns.speaker: DINO
turns.text: I promised him to Machine.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It's an honor to meet you.  Thank you for seeing us.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: What can I do for you today?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I'd like to commission a work.  I'm a great admirer of yours.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Flattering.  And, who's your colorful little chum?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: A fellow investor.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Hmm.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: You said something about money.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Yes.  What we're looking for is rather specific.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: That's five thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Is it?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Five thousand now, five thousand on delivery. Two women, one white and one black, as long as they have large breasts. Hard bondage, or course.  Other than that, trusting your artistic interpretation, I have only two stipulations.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: And they are?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I want to watch you work.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: I'll consider it.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: And the other performer... it has to be that monster you use... the man in the mask.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Machine.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: If it's not him, there's no deal.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: He might be interested... but it would mean another five thousand.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: We can do that.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Well, well, I'll have to put my thinking-cap on about all this. You'll leave the money as a deposit?  Very good.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: You have a beautiful face... the way the light hits it.  I'd like to take your picture.  You don't mind?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I'd rather you didn't.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: What's the problem?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I'm camera shy.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: You trust me to keep your money, but not to take your picture?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Those are two different kinds of trust.  Thank you for your time.  I hope we can do business.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: I'll do this for you.  Fifteen thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Machine's in?

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: He's in.  It will be his pleasure.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Where's that?

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Brooklyn.  Don't be late.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: You brought the money?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Right here.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Excellent.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Where are the women?

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: They should be here any minute.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: What are these for?

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Hmm?  Oh, the knifes?  They're just props.  Nice, aren't they?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Mister Welles... would you be so kind as to remove any firearms from your person?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: What are you... ?

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Take out your gun!

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Empty the gun onto the table, very carefully.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Look, I don't know what this...

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Shut up, cunt!  Do exactly as I say, or I'll put this arrow through your throat.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: You remember Mr. Longdale, don't you?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I remember him.

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Friend of yours?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Look, he's got nothing to do with this... let him go...

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Can you guess what I'm going to say next?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: He doesn't know anything... he's got nothing to do with this...

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Bring the film, or we kill him.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I'll get it.  It's in a safe deposit box, in the city...

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: How cooperative.  Longdale will keep you company.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Is that him?

turns.speaker: DINO VELVET
turns.text: Put the gun down, take the handcuffs.  Handcuff yourself to the bed.
